Posts.Content: Hello.  can I join the group too? I have my first zap on Thursday and I'm a bit nervous, so looking for reassurance. I had the planning/ tattoos a couple of weeks ago which was ok but I'm dreading the chin/ head strap which sent me into an irrational panic when they put it in place.  I've read that radiotherapy is easy compared to most experiences of chemo? would you agree?  thanks, Jacqui  x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I too have had a C section (14 yrs ago) and go for my dbl mx with DIEP on 8th Feb.  my BMI is 30. like lorna who.posted I'm at Whiston hospital with Ms Tadhazadie who has also.assured that if rads are needed,  there won't be a problem. I've just finished chemo (4 wks ago). scared but excited too! x
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: best of luck shellan. we'll be fine I'm sure.
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Hi mo ( tiger777) I've been advised to get a PICC because I always faint when anyone comes near me with a needle.  total wuss! I feel like I've walked into a horror film!  All these women on here have been through this in some way. ...so we can too. ( trying to convince myself and u!). keep in touch with your progress  hugs etc...jacqui x
Posts.Title: New chemo starter

Posts.Content: Hi tiger777 - I'll be starting mine that week so I'll be intrusted to share tips and notes! I think there' s a Chemo thread each month which I haven't yet looked at (head in sand) but intend to. The thought of getting a PICC inserted is terrifying me more I think! Keep well hun, take care Jacqui x
Posts.Title: New chemo starter

Posts.Content: Hi JoDec - what a bloody place to find ourselves!? It's like I've walked into another dimension - a new language, new rules, new major decision making. I'm already exhausted and I've only had a few scans & biopsies. I'm amazed where all these ladies get their energy and drive from - I'm hoping I'll get some by being here! I'll be thinking about you tomorrow /sending positive vibes hun. The waiting all the time is what I'm finding hard - I seem to lurch from one day to the next - dazed and confused! Hope your results are the very best they can be. I am back Fri too for last biopsy results whereupon I will hopefully have a clearer treatment plan and they will need my reconstruction decision - think I'm leaning towards immediate DIEP, although the lure of implants is seductive! Can't quite believe the decision making I'm doing! Fingers crossed for us both - let me know how you get on - sleep well tonight. Deep breaths Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi Jo - thanks for that. I too am scared of having surgery/ wounds front & back - so I have already eliminated the back flap. I can see given all the surgery you'd already had, that the thought of further surgery was just a step too bloody far! The tummy tuck is undoubtedly an attractive part of the offer though! But I think my biggest worry is the thought of implants being affected later on by rads. I'm such a wuss (needle phobic to boot!) that I can't bear the possibility of having to have surgery later on if the implants need more work. Can I ask if you have had any radiotherapy?  Thanks again Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Thanks J4N - I think I am being naïve in thinking that one op will sort all this! I'm studiously avoiding the fact that no option is guaranteed. They all sound scary! Thanks for sharing your experiences with me - all this is sooo helpful. Take care, Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hello - would welcome any advice/ thinking aloud/ previous decisions on how and why you came to your decisions about the type of reconstruction you went for?  I am changing my mind every day - have read all the info etc.. and made a list of pro's/ con's of each procedure, but still hugely confused as to what to do. I am worried about implants being compromised with radiotherapy etc... but not sure if I'm being naïve in thinking that DIEP - despite longer/ more complex procedure and recovery - is any more likely to reduce the need for further surgery in the future ...? I know we have choices, but sometimes I just wish I didn't have to make all these choices cos it's all a bit scary and unreal (I am wasting time googling nipple tattoos ffs) Help!
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Thanks Daisylou for getting back. Can I ask how long it was before you started to be able to do normal things - like getting in the bath, going out for a walk, driving?  Thanks again - Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi toxophilite - thank you for your advice and support here. Yes - my initial thought was speed of recovery/ least surgery, just so I can get back to 'normal' life with my family. It's amazing that you were up and about - and shooting your arrows - in such a short space of time! That is amazing. The most energetic I intend getting in the first few weeks will be hanging washing on the line - or pouring a very large gin & tonic!  Thanks again - take good care Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Thanks ever so much Gay for sharing that with me. My nipples are buggered so I'll have to come up with alternatives! Sounds like a full on roller coaster for you! 9 days - that is a rapid turnaround! And here's me moaning about all the waiting in between results and a  finalised treatment plan! Can I ask you if you will be getting any radiotherapy? That's the only bit that worries me about the implants.  I know it's a small worry in the grand scheme of everything that we're dealing with, but it's still another worry I've got! Thanks Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi Clare (Daisylou) - can I ask: are you pleased with the result/ your decision?  Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Thanks Daydream - an implant was my initial thought, for exactly the reason you say (limited scaring/ recovery) but now I'm thinking about it possibly being compromised with rads; so to avoid that, I'm thinking of the DIEP. It's such a messy decision isn't it!  Thanks for sharing with me - hoping you're back in your bra soon hun! I suppose for the first time in my life my fat may be useful! Take good care Jacqui
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Thanks Jo for the information links. I do have a Section scar, but he had a nosey last week and said it's very low down, so there shouldn't be a problem for the DIEP (I think he was politely saying 'you've got a lot of flesh there we can still play with, love').  I am slightly concerned about any future need for a hysterectomy (I'm family history - so awaiting BRCA gene results). I'll ask about this at my next appointment on Friday when I get final biopsy results & finalise treatment plan. Feel like I'm surrendering myself to be butchered! Thanks again Jo for you advice Jacqui x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: tyneside mistymoley us the recovery is longer but going that the chances of subsequent surgery is less. such a huge decision.thanks everdo much for your input x
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: https://community.macmillan.org.uk/cancer_types/breast-cancer/f/38/t/134879 Hi Topo - I asked the same question (link above for thread) with some DIEP comments that you may find helpful. It is such a tough decision - good luck with it. Jacqui
Posts.Title: DCIS - DIEP or implant reconstruction?

Posts.Content: Hi topo. I've settled on the diep. I know it's more complex with longer recovery than the orhers but hoping it'll reduce chances of future surgery. scared about implants being compromised if need rads later on. I also like the idea of real boobs. ..moving and ageing with me!  The tummy tuck silver lining swung it! x
Posts.Title: DCIS - DIEP or implant reconstruction?
